alert.note: Alert for Cape Girardeau; Mississippi; Scott (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 12 at 8:23AM CST by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southern Illinois, including the following counties, Alexander, Pulaski and Union, western Kentucky, including the following counties, Ballard, Carlisle and Hickman, and southeast Missouri, including the following counties, Cape Girardeau, Mississippi and Scott. * WHEN...Until 1230 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 823 AM CST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Cape Girardeau, Charleston, Scott City, East Prairie, Chaffee, Cairo, Benton, Bardwell, Wickliffe, Towosahgy State Historic Site, Bertrand, Mounds, Barlow, Tamms, Mound City, Kelso, Gordonville, Wyatt, Anniston and Dutchtown.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
